name: Vegan Cowboy Cookies Mix in a Jar
description: 1 Bowl Coconut Oatmeal Pecan Chocolate Chip Cookies. Vegan Cowboy Cookies Mix in a Jar. Makes great Jar gift for the Holiday Season. Layer oats, flour, coconut, chocolate sugar and pecans. Mix, add applesauce and oil, and bake. Can be gluten-free. Makes 16 to 20 cookies based on size. Fill a 32 oz or 4 cup jar
recipeIngredient: 1 cup flour ((I use unbleached white flour, See notes for gluten-free option))
3/4 tsp cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice
2/3 cup shredded coconut (, use 1/2 cup for less coconutty)
3/4 cup vegan chocolate chips (,I use a mix of regular and mini size)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flour, cinnamon, baking powder, soda, salt and 1/4 cup sugar. Whisk well and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the flour, cinnamon, baking powder, soda, salt and 1/4 cup sugar. Whisk well and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a 4 cup(32 oz) mason jar, add the oats, then add coconut, tap to settle, then add chocolate chips, then 1/2 cup sugar. Tap to settle. Add the flour mixture. Tap a couple of times to settle, so that there is space for the pecans. Add the chopped pecans. Add as many as you can.
recipeInstructions.name: In a 4 cup(32 oz) mason jar, add the oats, then add coconut, tap to settle, then add chocolate chips, then 1/2 cup sugar. Tap to settle. Add the flour mixture. Tap a couple of times to settle, so that there is space for the pecans. Add the chopped pecans. Add as many as you can.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid. Add instructions and store.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid. Add instructions and store.
Bake the cookies: (Instructions on the Jar)

itemListElement.text: Empty the contents of the jar in a large bowl. Mix well to combine. Make a well a center. (see note if not making a jar)
itemListElement.name: Empty the contents of the jar in a large bowl. Mix well to combine. Make a well a center. (see note if not making a jar)

itemListElement.text: Add applesauce, 1/3 cup oil and vanilla extract and whisk them in the center to mix a bit.
itemListElement.name: Add applesauce, 1/3 cup oil and vanilla extract and whisk them in the center to mix a bit.

itemListElement.text: Then mix in with the dry ingredients. Press down and mix for a few seconds. Add a tbsp more oil if needed and mix in. The dough should start to come together even though crumbly. Chill the mixture for an hour for best results.
itemListElement.name: Then mix in with the dry ingredients. Press down and mix for a few seconds. Add a tbsp more oil if needed and mix in. The dough should start to come together even though crumbly. Chill the mixture for an hour for best results.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a sheet with parchment. Make flat discs of the dough and place on the baking sheet.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a sheet with parchment. Make flat discs of the dough and place on the baking sheet.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 11 to 13 mins, depending on size. Cool for 10 mins. Store on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for longer.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 11 to 13 mins, depending on size. Cool for 10 mins. Store on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for longer.
